Commonclipse
Last Published: 2012-07-23  | Version: 1.4.0-SNAPSHOT
Maven | Eclipse | Jakarta commons-lang

Project Documentation

Fixes compatibility with eclipe 3.1 M6. The 1.3 release is packaged with the new plugin format (a single jar) introduced with eclipse 3.1M6. Note that installing from the updatesite at the moment still unpacks the plugin (it seems that the update feature still doesn't support the new format): if you want to use the new format you have to manually download the distribution zip. Generate equals() label incorrect Optionally add final to equals and compareTo. (requested by Archimedes Trajano) Added the osgi bundle to the plugin jar (was missing in the build script). This allows the plugin to be activated without restarting eclipse after installation. Reorganized preference page for better readability. Add "implements Comparable" when generating the compareTo method and the class doesn't implement Comparable yet. Updated to use the new Eclipse 3.0 API. This version requires Eclipse 3 and will not run on the 2.x series Generated methods are now properly formatted according user preferences (using the new Eclipse 3 formatter) You can now use wildcards in excluded fields list. (requested by Ludovic Bailly) New option to add an instance equality check to equals() methods (requested by Jay Glanville) i18n and italian translation added Don't add methods to read only files (previously it ignored file state for right clicks in the editor). Boolean javabean properties are now properly included in toString() Commonclipse preference page is now placed in the "Java" category. Multiple types in the same .java file are handled on editor actions: you can now select inner or non-primary classes in java files. Better check for valid custom ToStringStyle in preferences. Plugin dependencies updated for Eclipse 3.0 M6. Added Eclipse update site for automatic installation. Commonclipse 1.0.0 released.
